Articles.Content: I have a base on Ike, but I can't use RCS to fly? It's as if Ike has the same gravity as Kerbin? Anyone else experience this?
Ike shouldn't have as much gravity as Kerbin, it's smaller than Duna. Do you have fine control on (Caps Lock?) it limits the thrust of all RCS based propellers including EVA controls.
Do you have KIS/KAS installed? If yes, keep in mind the Kerbals become as heavy as the parts they are equipped with. Just a thought.

4 hours ago, Dafni said:

Do you have KIS/KAS installed? If yes, keep in mind the Kerbals become as heavy as the parts they are equipped with. Just a thought.

This, its tempting to stuff kerbal pockets before launch with KIS, also you can scavenge things in space. Suddenly you can not fly on Minmus

5 minutes ago, magnemoe said:

This, its tempting to stuff kerbal pockets before launch with KIS, also you can scavenge things in space. Suddenly you can not fly on Minmus

 

Sorry Jeb, but if you wanna fly you have to drop the ghetto blaster.
Ike is weird anyway, it keeps saying that I'm on southpole while I'm on north.

9 hours ago, StrandedonEarth said:

Sorry Jeb, but if you wanna fly you have to drop the ghetto blaster.

Had an tanker I wanted to upgrade with vernier trusters for more control during aerobrake 
Kerbal was unable to fly with more than 3 in inventory and that was more like Duna jetpack use.

I have, also, had this happen, while KIS/KAS is installed but when my kerbals are not carrying anything... However it might be happening after they have connected 2 parts together using fuel couplings of UKS flex-o-tubes so it could be there's some weird persistence issue where the game is not realising you've put something down. I may experiment next time I get to Ike.
I can report that without KIS/KAS, EVA and all other operations on Ike work as expected.
